intro: Senecio lautus subsp. dissectifolius, commonly known as the dissectedleaf groundsel, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a distinctive, almost fern-like appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
